title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Timothy chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Timothy Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who is the apostle mentioned in 2 Timothy 1:1?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:1 states that Paul is an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God.

questions.question: To whom is the letter in 2 Timothy 1 addressed?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:2 addresses the letter to Timothy, referred to as 'my dearly beloved son.'

questions.question: What three blessings does Paul wish Timothy in 2 Timothy 1:2?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:2 mentions grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus.

questions.question: What does Paul say he does without ceasing for Timothy in 2 Timothy 1:3?
options: Prays for him night and day
questions.correctAnswer: Prays for him night and day
questions.explanation: In 2 Timothy 1:3, Paul thanks God and remembers Timothy in his prayers without ceasing.

questions.question: Who are the two women mentioned in 2 Timothy 1:5 as having unfeigned faith?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:5 mentions Timothy's grandmother Lois and mother Eunice as having genuine faith.

questions.question: What does Paul urge Timothy to stir up according to 2 Timothy 1:6?
questions.explanation: Paul reminds Timothy to stir up the gift of God which is in him, as stated in 2 Timothy 1:6.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:7, what spirit has God given us?
options: A spirit of power, love, and a sound mind
questions.correctAnswer: A spirit of power, love, and a sound mind
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:7 clearly states that God gave us a spirit of power, love, and a sound mind, not of fear.

questions.question: What is Timothy told not to be ashamed of in 2 Timothy 1:8?
options: The testimony of our Lord and Paul
questions.correctAnswer: The testimony of our Lord and Paul
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:8 encourages Timothy not to be ashamed of the testimony of the Lord or Paul, who is a prisoner.

questions.question: By what means has Jesus Christ brought life and immortality to light, according to 2 Timothy 1:10?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:10 says Jesus Christ brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.

questions.question: What roles does Paul say he has been appointed to in 2 Timothy 1:11?
options: Preacher, apostle, and teacher of the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: Preacher, apostle, and teacher of the Gentiles
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:11 states Paul was appointed as a preacher, apostle, and teacher of the Gentiles.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says he is ashamed of the sufferings he endures for the gospel in 2 Timothy 1:12.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:12 says Paul is not ashamed of his sufferings because he knows whom he has believed.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Timothy 1:14, Paul instructs Timothy to keep the good thing committed to him by the Holy Ghost.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:14 instructs Timothy to keep the good thing committed by the Holy Ghost dwelling in us.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 1:15, all in Asia remained faithful to Paul.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:15 states that all in Asia turned away from Paul, including Phygellus and Hermogenes.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Timothy 1:7: 'For God hath not given us the spirit of ______;'
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:7 says God has not given us the spirit of fear, but of power, love, and a sound mind.

questions.question: Who is praised in 2 Timothy 1:16 for often refreshing Paul and not being ashamed of his chains?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:16 praises the house of Onesiphorus for their kindness to Paul despite his imprisonment.

medium.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Timothy Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear in their service to God. Based on 2 Timothy 1, what biblical truth would you share to encourage them?
options: God has given us a spirit of fear to keep us cautious.
God has given us a spirit of power, love, and a sound mind.
We should avoid challenges to prevent fear.
Fear is a sign of weak faith and must be ignored.
questions.correctAnswer: God has given us a spirit of power, love, and a sound mind.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:7 teaches that God has not given us a spirit of fear but of power, love, and a sound mind. This encourages believers to serve God boldly without fear. Supporting verses include 2 Timothy 1:8 and 2 Timothy 1:12, which emphasize courage and confidence in God during trials.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 1 instruct believers to respond when facing suffering for the gospel?
options: To be ashamed and hide their faith.
To be partakers of the afflictions according to God's power.
To avoid suffering at all costs.
To seek revenge on those who cause suffering.
questions.correctAnswer: To be partakers of the afflictions according to God's power.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:8 encourages believers not to be ashamed of the gospel or Paul’s imprisonment but to share in the afflictions for the gospel’s sake through God's power. This teaches perseverance and faithfulness amid trials.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged and forgetful in using their spiritual gifts. According to 2 Timothy 1, what should they be reminded to do?
options: To hide their gift for later use.
To stir up the gift of God within them.
To seek new gifts from others.
To rely only on human strength.
questions.correctAnswer: To stir up the gift of God within them.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:6 instructs Timothy to stir up the gift of God that is in him, reminding believers to actively use and cultivate their spiritual gifts for service. Verses 2 Timothy 1:13-14 also emphasize holding fast to sound teaching and guarding the good thing entrusted by the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: What does Paul emphasize about the nature of our calling and salvation in 2 Timothy 1?
options: It depends on our good works.
It is according to God's own purpose and grace.
It comes from human effort and discipline.
It is earned by personal merit.
questions.correctAnswer: It is according to God's own purpose and grace.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:9 explains that God saved and called us with a holy calling not because of our works but according to His own purpose and grace, highlighting the foundation of faith and humility in Christian living. This is reinforced by the manifestation of salvation through Jesus Christ in verse 10.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 1 teach about perseverance in faith despite opposition or desertion by others?
options: To give up when others abandon you.
To remember those who support you and continue faithfully.
To retaliate against those who turn away.
questions.correctAnswer: To remember those who support you and continue faithfully.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:15-18 contrasts those who turned away with Onesiphorus who faithfully sought Paul and refreshed him. This teaches believers to persevere by valuing faithful fellowship and support even when others desert them.

questions.question: A Christian parent wants to nurture genuine faith in their child. According to 2 Timothy 1, what example does Paul give about faith passed down in a family?
options: Faith comes only from personal study.
Faith dwelt first in Timothy’s grandmother Lois and mother Eunice.
Faith should be hidden from children.
questions.correctAnswer: Faith dwelt first in Timothy’s grandmother Lois and mother Eunice.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:5 highlights the sincere faith in Timothy that first lived in his grandmother Lois and mother Eunice, demonstrating the importance of godly parenting and family influence in nurturing faith.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Timothy 1, Paul encourages Timothy to be ashamed of the gospel because it brings suffering.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:8 explicitly instructs Timothy not to be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord nor of Paul’s imprisonment but to be bold in sharing the gospel despite suffering.

questions.question: True or False: Paul expresses confidence that God is able to keep what has been committed to Him until the final day.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:12 shows Paul’s confidence in God’s ability to guard what he has entrusted to Him, encouraging believers to trust God’s faithfulness in preservation and judgment.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul reminds Timothy to hold fast to the form of sound ________, which he heard from Paul, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:13 instructs Timothy to hold fast the form of sound words heard from Paul, emphasizing the importance of faithful adherence to biblical teaching as a foundation for love and faith.

questions.question: Based on 2 Timothy 1, how should a believer approach prayer and remembrance of fellow believers?
options: Pray without ceasing and remember them night and day.
questions.correctAnswer: Pray without ceasing and remember them night and day.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:3 shows Paul’s continual remembrance of Timothy in prayer night and day, teaching the value of persistent prayer and loving intercession for others.

questions.question: What role does the Holy Spirit play in the believer’s stewardship according to 2 Timothy 1?
options: The Holy Spirit replaces personal responsibility.
The Holy Spirit helps to keep the good thing entrusted to the believer.
The Holy Spirit only works in public ministry.
The Holy Spirit is unrelated to spiritual gifts.
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit helps to keep the good thing entrusted to the believer.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:14 teaches that believers are to keep the good thing committed to them by the Holy Spirit dwelling within, emphasizing the Spirit’s role in guarding and empowering faithful stewardship.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 1 illustrate the importance of joy in Christian fellowship?
options: Paul desires to see Timothy to be filled with joy.
Joy should be hidden in public.
questions.correctAnswer: Paul desires to see Timothy to be filled with joy.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:4 shows Paul’s longing to see Timothy, mindful of his tears, so that he may be filled with joy, highlighting joy as a fruit of fellowship and encouragement amidst hardships.

questions.question: What example does 2 Timothy 1 give of faithful support during imprisonment?
options: Phygellus and Hermogenes supported Paul in prison.
Onesiphorus sought Paul out diligently and refreshed him.
Paul was left to suffer alone.
questions.correctAnswer: Onesiphorus sought Paul out diligently and refreshed him.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:16-17 describes how Onesiphorus was not ashamed of Paul’s chains and diligently sought him in Rome, providing a model of faithful and practical support in times of trial.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1, what is the ultimate manifestation of God's purpose and grace in salvation?
options: The appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: The appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:10 teaches that God’s grace and purpose were made manifest by the appearing of Jesus Christ, who abolished death and brought life and immortality through the gospel, underscoring Christ’s central role in salvation.

questions.question: How does 2 Timothy 1 instruct believers to maintain integrity in their teaching and conduct?
options: By holding fast the form of sound words in faith and love.
By changing teachings to please others.
By relying on human wisdom alone.
questions.correctAnswer: By holding fast the form of sound words in faith and love.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:13 encourages holding fast to sound words heard from Paul, in faith and love in Christ Jesus, stressing integrity and faithfulness in teaching and living out the gospel.

hard.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Timothy Chapter 1.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 1:7, Paul states that God has given us a spirit of power, love, and what else, contrasting it with the spirit of fear? How does this reflect the Greek concept of 'sōphrosynē' (sound mind)?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:7 uses the Greek term related to 'sōphrosynē', often rendered as 'sound mind' or 'self-control', emphasizing balanced and disciplined thinking rather than fear.

questions.question: Paul's reference to Timothy's faith coming first from his grandmother Lois and mother Eunice (2 Timothy 1:5) highlights what cultural value in the ancient Near East?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:5 emphasizes the role of women, Lois and Eunice, in passing faith, reflecting the cultural value of family and matriarchal influence in religious formation.

questions.question: Which theme in 2 Timothy 1:9 connects to the Old Testament concept of 'calling' as seen in Exodus 3 with Moses?
options: Holy calling not based on works
questions.correctAnswer: Holy calling not based on works
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:9 speaks of a holy calling by God's purpose and grace, paralleling Moses’ divine call in Exodus 3, emphasizing God’s initiative rather than human merit.

questions.question: The phrase 'putting on of my hands' in 2 Timothy 1:6 is best understood as a reference to what early Christian practice?
options: Laying on of hands for blessing
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:6 references the laying on of hands as a symbolic act of commissioning Timothy to stir up his God-given gift, a practice linked to ordination.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 1:10, Paul speaks of Jesus Christ bringing life and immortality to light. Which Old Testament hope does this most directly fulfill?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:10’s theme of life and immortality through Christ fulfills the resurrection hope articulated in Daniel 12, where the dead awaken to everlasting life.

questions.question: Paul identifies himself as a preacher, apostle, and teacher of the Gentiles in 2 Timothy 1:11. How does this triple role reflect the early church’s mission strategy?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:11 shows Paul's comprehensive ministry roles: preaching (evangelism), apostleship (church planting), and teaching (doctrine), integral to early church expansion.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in 2 Timothy 1:12 when Paul says, 'I know whom I have believed,' emphasizing his confidence in God despite suffering?
questions.explanation: The phrase in 2 Timothy 1:12 frames Paul's statement with confidence and suffering, creating an inclusio that brackets his trust in God as central to his message.

questions.question: 2 Timothy 1:14 instructs Timothy to keep the 'good thing' committed to him by the Holy Ghost. How does this command relate to the Hebrew concept of 'emunah' (faithfulness)?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:14’s exhortation to guard the entrusted gift aligns with 'emunah,' emphasizing loyalty and faithfulness to divine truth.

questions.question: Which historical context is illuminated by Paul's mention of being a prisoner in 2 Timothy 1:8?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:8 reflects Paul’s likely imprisonment under Nero’s persecution in Rome, providing first-century historical context.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 1:16-17, Paul praises Onesiphorus for not being ashamed of his chains. How does this exemplify the early Christian virtue of 'storgē' (familial love)?
options: Demonstrates loyalty and support akin to family
questions.correctAnswer: Demonstrates loyalty and support akin to family
questions.explanation: Paul’s commendation in 2 Timothy 1:16-17 illustrates storgē, the affectionate, loyal care resembling family bonds within the Christian community.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:15, which two individuals are named as having turned away from Paul, and what does this reflect about early church challenges?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:15 names Phygellus and Hermogenes as those who abandoned Paul, reflecting internal opposition and desertion in early Christian missions.

questions.question: True or False: Paul’s mention of 'the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus' in 2 Timothy 1:1 suggests a theme consistent with the Johannine literature's emphasis on eternal life.
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:1’s reference to the promise of life in Christ echoes the Johannine theme of eternal life as a present and future reality (see John 3:16).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul encourages Timothy to 'stir up the _____ of God' which is in him by the laying on of Paul's hands (2 Timothy 1:6).
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:6 calls Timothy to rekindle or stir up the 'gift' of God imparted through Paul's laying on of hands.

questions.question: How does Paul’s appeal to Timothy to 'hold fast the form of sound words' in 2 Timothy 1:13 connect to the Jewish tradition of 'torah' preservation?
options: It parallels careful transmission of divine teaching
questions.correctAnswer: It parallels careful transmission of divine teaching
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:13 urges Timothy to preserve correct teaching, paralleling Jewish respect for faithful transmission of the Torah.

questions.question: Paul's statement in 2 Timothy 1:4 about being mindful of Timothy's tears and desiring to see him can be seen as an example of which literary device common in ancient letters?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:4 uses emotional appeal, a common ancient letter technique to strengthen relational bonds and encourage the recipient.

theological.title: 2 Timothy Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Timothy Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:1, by whose will was Paul appointed an apostle of Jesus Christ?
options: The will of the church elders
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:1 states that Paul was an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God. This highlights divine election and calling, consistent with Acts 9:15, Romans 1:1, and Galatians 1:1 where Paul’s apostleship is attributed to God's sovereign will.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 1:5, whose genuine faith does Paul recall as a heritage in Timothy?
options: His grandmother Lois and mother Eunice
questions.correctAnswer: His grandmother Lois and mother Eunice
questions.explanation: Paul mentions in 2 Timothy 1:5 the unfeigned faith that first dwelt in Timothy’s grandmother Lois and mother Eunice. This shows the transmission of faith within the family, paralleling the importance of faith heritage seen in Deuteronomy 6:6-7 and 2 Timothy 3:15.

questions.question: What does Paul exhort Timothy to 'stir up' in 2 Timothy 1:6?
questions.explanation: Paul commands Timothy to stir up the gift of God given by the laying on of hands (2 Timothy 1:6). This refers to the spiritual gifts empowered by the Holy Spirit, reflecting themes in 1 Timothy 4:14 and Romans 12:6 about using spiritual gifts for the church.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:7, what kind of spirit has God NOT given us?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:7 teaches that God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and a sound mind. This contrasts divine empowerment with human timidity, resonating with Isaiah 41:10, Romans 8:15, and 1 John 4:18.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 1:8, Paul urges Timothy not to be ashamed of what?
options: The testimony of our Lord and Paul as His prisoner
questions.correctAnswer: The testimony of our Lord and Paul as His prisoner
questions.explanation: Paul tells Timothy in 2 Timothy 1:8 not to be ashamed of the testimony of the Lord, nor of Paul’s imprisonment, encouraging faithful witness despite suffering. This is consistent with Acts 5:41 and Hebrews 13:3 regarding rejoicing in suffering for Christ.

questions.question: What is the nature of the calling Paul describes in 2 Timothy 1:9?
options: A holy calling according to God's purpose and grace
A calling based on human works
questions.correctAnswer: A holy calling according to God's purpose and grace
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:9 emphasizes that God’s calling is holy and based on His purpose and grace, not on works. This aligns with Ephesians 2:8-9 and Romans 8:28 regarding salvation by grace and divine purpose.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:10, what has Jesus Christ abolished and brought to light?
options: Death abolished; life and immortality brought to light
Sin abolished; righteousness brought to light
Law abolished; grace brought to light
Suffering abolished; peace brought to light
questions.correctAnswer: Death abolished; life and immortality brought to light
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Timothy 1:10 reveals Jesus abolishing death and bringing life and immortality to light through the gospel. This is foundational to Christian eschatology, consistent with John 11:25-26, 1 Corinthians 15:54-57, and Revelation 1:18.

questions.question: What three roles does Paul say he has been appointed to in 2 Timothy 1:11?
options: Preacher, apostle, and teacher of the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: Preacher, apostle, and teacher of the Gentiles
questions.explanation: Paul states in 2 Timothy 1:11 that he is appointed preacher, apostle, and teacher to the Gentiles, highlighting his divinely given ministry roles for spreading the gospel, in line with Acts 9:15 and Romans 11:13.

questions.question: Why does Paul say he is not ashamed in 2 Timothy 1:12?
options: Because he knows whom he has believed and trusts in God's ability to guard his deposit
Because he is confident in his own strength
questions.correctAnswer: Because he knows whom he has believed and trusts in God's ability to guard his deposit
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:12 shows Paul’s confidence grounded in faith in Christ, who can guard what Paul has committed to Him. This reflects trust in divine faithfulness, echoed in 1 Timothy 1:12, Psalm 37:5, and Philippians 1:6.

questions.question: What does Paul instruct Timothy to hold fast in 2 Timothy 1:13?
options: The form of sound words heard from Paul, in faith and love in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The form of sound words heard from Paul, in faith and love in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts Timothy in 2 Timothy 1:13 to hold fast the sound doctrine he was taught, rooted in faith and love in Christ. This is consistent with Jude 3, Titus 1:9, and Colossians 2:6-7 emphasizing doctrinal purity and steadfastness.

questions.question: According to 2 Timothy 1:14, by what means should Timothy keep the good deposit entrusted to him?
options: By the Holy Spirit dwelling in us
questions.correctAnswer: By the Holy Spirit dwelling in us
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Timothy 1:14 instructs Timothy to guard the entrusted teaching through the Holy Spirit who dwells within believers, affirming the role of the Spirit in preservation of truth, as seen in John 14:26, Romans 8:11, and Ephesians 3:16.

questions.question: In 2 Timothy 1:15, who does Paul say have turned away from him in Asia?
questions.explanation: Paul notes in 2 Timothy 1:15 that Phygellus and Hermogenes are among those in Asia who have turned away from him, illustrating early apostolic rejection, which parallels similar challenges faced by prophets in Jeremiah 15:17 and Jesus in John 6:66.

questions.question: What kind of mercy does Paul pray for the household of Onesiphorus in 2 Timothy 1:16?
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:16 prays for the Lord’s mercy on Onesiphorus’ household, emphasizing divine grace and compassion, consistent with Psalm 103:17, Lamentations 3:22-23, and Ephesians 2:4-5.

questions.question: How did Onesiphorus support Paul according to 2 Timothy 1:17?
options: He sought Paul diligently in Rome and refreshed him
He sent financial aid from Ephesus
questions.correctAnswer: He sought Paul diligently in Rome and refreshed him
questions.explanation: 2 Timothy 1:17 describes Onesiphorus’ faithful ministry to Paul by diligently seeking him out in Rome and refreshing him, demonstrating faithful Christian service, paralleling Acts 20:35 and Hebrews 6:10 about serving others.

questions.question: What does Paul ask the Lord to grant Onesiphorus in 2 Timothy 1:18?
options: Mercy of the Lord on that day
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy of the Lord on that day
questions.explanation: Paul prays in 2 Timothy 1:18 that Onesiphorus may find mercy from the Lord on the day of judgment, highlighting eschatological hope and divine grace, consistent with Micah 7:18 and Hebrews 4:16.
